Text:

thepiratebay.org/torrent/6470778
Wow, you were able to get all of them! Thanks! I'm still trying, my Internet speed is not very good.

I got lucky and had advance notice so I was the first one 
there and had half of them downloaded by the time their 
server bogged down.

I have hooked this torrent up to my copies so now you have 
two seeds.  ; )

It seemed like it took forever, but I created a new upload with all the files, see:

http://thepiratebay.org/torrent/6472898

How do you connect torrents? Not sure what you mean, but thanks, it will take a long time for others to download. I'm just getting started reading... will take a long time to get through them all. The links you posted look interesting.

I'll write a guide.  It can get complicated really fast.

If everything goes right the first time do it like so:
_____________________________________________
Merging a New Torrent with an Existing Torrent\
================================================================
1.a - When the files are all of the same set, set the download
location of the new torrent to the same folder as the first one.

1.b - When filenames differ use Relocate to point each file in 
the new torrent to the existing file.

1.c - At this point, Force Recheck to verify that the files are 
indeed identical. 

1.d - If all the files check out good Force Start the torrent,
sharing everything instantly.  You are done.

Okay, here's how I handle more complex cases:

[TIP] Advanced uTorrent: Quickly seeding torrents with existing files:

https://www.technutopia.com/forum/showthread.php?t=7737

Thanks for the explanations. Much appreciated. I'm reasonably technical about some things, but very little about torrent'ing...

SSL is temporarily broken on that Technutopia [TIP] link.
Just use HTTP without the S and it will still work.
